snippet: Local militants have claimed responsibility for an attack that killed 14 police officers and at least one civilian, easing concerns that the Islamic State had been involved.
abstract: Residents of Grozny, capital city of Chechen Republic, Russia, are relieved at possibility that militant attack on city was by local radical Islamic group Caucasus Emirate rather than Islamic State militants; video of attack shows local man citing grievances related to head scarves as reasons for assault.
lead_paragraph: Local militants have claimed responsibility for an attack that killed 14 police officers and at least one civilian, easing concerns that the Islamic State had been involved.

headline.main: Signs That Attackers Came From Within Mitigate Alarm in Chechnya
headline.print_headline: Signs That Attackers Came From Within Mitigate Alarm in Chechnya

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
